Where Are You on the Ladder?
Where Are You on the Ladder?

Reflect With a Partner
Reflect With a Partner

What makes sense to me? What are my out-of-control behaviors? What specifically do I need to do to get back into my power when I am out-of- control? What kind of support from my fellow LAOs would be most helpful to me?
What makes sense to me?
What are my out-of-control behaviors?
What specifically do I need to do to get
back into my power when I am out-of-
control?
What kind of support from my fellow
LAOs would be most helpful to me?

Area Group Sharing
Area Group Sharing

What are one or two things we could do as an Area to better support each other?
What are one or two
things we could do
as an Area to better
support each other?

What agreements do we need to make so we can vent and then problem-solve?
What agreements do
we need to make so
we can vent and
then problem-solve?

The Meaning of
The Meaning of

is the Outcome
is the Outcome i s
t h e
O u t c o m e

Refer specifically and only to the other person’s behavior, not their intentions (which you don’t know, anyway!) You are letting them know the impact of their behavior on you–something that might be of interest and value to them You are not telling them what to do or what kind of person they are
Refer specifically and only to the other
person’s behavior, not their intentions
(which you don’t know, anyway!)
You are letting them know the impact of
their behavior on you–something that
might be of interest and value to them
You are not telling them what to do or
what kind of person they are

Just the Facts! What would a TV camera record of the situation? Point = start with a platform of agreement about the facts of the situation If you can’t get agreement on the facts, ask if you can simply proceed on the basis of your perception of the facts
Just the Facts!
What would a TV camera record of the
situation?
Point = start with a platform of agreement
about the facts of the situation
If you can’t get agreement on the facts, ask if
you can simply proceed on the basis of your
perception of the facts

Feelings get attention, since they indicate levels of intensity Stating your feeling reveals the source of your motivation Knowing your feelings helps you to determine what you truly want to have happen
Feelings get attention, since they
indicate levels of intensity
Stating your feeling reveals the source
of your motivation
Knowing your feelings helps you to
determine what you truly want to have
happen

Glad: happy, excited, pleased, delighted, joyful, peaceful, powerful Sad: unhappy, depressed, grieving, down, lost Mad: angry, miffed, enraged, irritated, nettled, ticked off Afraid: scared, fearful, anxious, nervous, worried
Glad: happy, excited, pleased, delighted,
joyful, peaceful, powerful
Sad: unhappy, depressed, grieving,
down, lost
Mad: angry, miffed, enraged, irritated,
nettled, ticked off
Afraid: scared, fearful, anxious,
nervous, worried

The facts of any situation get quickly lost in what we make of them Interpretations & conclusions We make up a story about what happened and then believe the story Important to let the other person know how you are interpreting what he/she did
The facts of any situation get quickly
lost in what we make of them
Interpretations & conclusions
We make up a story about what
happened and then believe the story
Important to let the other person know
how you are interpreting what he/she
did

Declaring what you want, rather than what you don’t want, is an act of power You may want many things; keep it simple Even though you are stating what you want, you are not making a demand Especially if you want something from the other person, make sure you let that person know what you want for the two of you—to improve your relationship
Declaring what you want, rather than what
you don’t want, is an act of power
You may want many things; keep it simple
Even though you are stating what you want,
you are not making a demand
Especially if you want something from the
other person, make sure you let that person
know what you want for the two of you—to
improve your relationship

In order to prove that you are not simply making a demand, state what you are willing to do to get what you want Make this an act of partnership At minimum you can be willing to listen to the other person and/or make time for working out an agreement
In order to prove that you are not simply
making a demand, state what you are
willing to do to get what you want
Make this an act of partnership
At minimum you can be willing to listen
to the other person and/or make time for
working out an agreement

Plan your communication so you actually say what you want and get the message across Deal with a difficult situation in a good way Praise someone clearly and specifically Get the other person’s attention Say it in a non-defensive way Report the impact of the other’s behavior on you
Plan your communication so you actually say
what you want and get the message across
Deal with a difficult situation in a good way
Praise someone clearly and specifically
Get the other person’s attention
Say it in a non-defensive way
Report the impact of the other’s behavior on
you

Think of a communication you have been meaning to do but haven’t done Use the Wheel to plan what you’re going to say Practice with your partner Partner check for form to make sure the communication was clean and clear
Think of a communication you have
been meaning to do but haven’t done
Use the Wheel to plan what you’re going
to say
Practice with your partner
Partner check for form to make sure the
communication was clean and clear

Debrief with Partner
Debrief with Partner

What was it like to use this method? How might you tighten your communication to make it clearer and sharper? What other uses can you see for this form of communication? How might you find a way to practice so you can do it naturally?
What was it like to use this method?
How might you tighten your
communication to make it clearer and
sharper?
What other uses can you see for this
form of communication?
How might you find a way to practice so
you can do it naturally?

The Art of Persuasion
The Art of Persuasion

WIIFM State the benefits to the other up front Plan, don’t wing it! Know what you want What emotion do you need to call on in order to get action?
WIIFM
State the benefits to
the other up front
Plan, don’t wing it!
Know what you want
What emotion do
you need to call on
in order to get
action?

Emotion…motion… move…motivate Root of all action is in emotion, not logic Like, want, not like, not want Logic only explains what we want
Emotion…motion…
move…motivate
Root of all action is
in emotion, not logic
Like, want, not like,
not want
Logic only explains
what we want

Glad: happy, excited, pleased, delighted, joyful, peaceful, powerful Sad: unhappy, depressed, grieving, down, lost Mad: angry, miffed, enraged, irritated, nettled, ticked off Afraid: scared, fearful, anxious, nervous, worried

h a p p y ,

delighted, joyful, peaceful, powerful

down, lost

Balance and Self Care
Balance and Self Care

I have to do it all Asking for help is a sign of weakness I can’t (won’t) say “no” No pain, no gain! I never come first If you want it done right, do it yourself
I have to do it all
Asking for help is a
sign of weakness
I can’t (won’t) say
“no”
No pain, no gain!
I never come first
If you want it done
right, do it yourself

LAO Peer Support
LAO Peer Support

Middles are always torn between “Tops” and “Bottoms” Dysfunctional resolution for being torn is either to ally UP or DOWN The job is lonely: can’t talk with anyone Only appropriate resolution is to ally with your peers: They get it!
Middles are always torn between “Tops”
and “Bottoms”
Dysfunctional resolution for being torn
is either to ally UP or DOWN
The job is lonely: can’t talk with anyone
Only appropriate resolution is to ally
with your peers: They get it!
